section.p: The following table lists the parameters to configure features and functions. Refer to About Feature Settings section in for more information about the features and functions.

entry.p: Maximum number of entries in the Blocked Files log
File extension for Script Lockdown to block
For example, specify a value of MSI to block .msi files
Interpreter for the specified file extension
For example, specify msiexec.exe as the interpreter for .msi files
Unique name for the set of rules
Enable hash checks for programs executed using the Trusted Updater
Disable hash checks for programs executed using the Trusted Updater
Path of the parent process to add to the Trusted Updater List
Path to exclude from the Trusted Updater List
Use the specified MSI or BAT file
Use the EXE, MSI, or BAT file in the specified folder
Use the EXE, MSI or BAT files in the specified folder and its subfolders
Condition ID to provide a more detailed rule for the Trusted Updater
Allow Windows Update to run on the managed endpoint when it is locked down
Block Windows Update on the managed endpoint when it is locked down
ExceptionPathList: Container for the Exception List
Use the files in the specified folder
Use the files in the specified folder and its subfolders
Use an exception using the regular expression
File signed by this certificate is treated as a Trusted Update
File signed by this certificate is not treated as a Trusted Update
Enable using the Trusted Hash List
Disable using the Trusted Hash List
File matched by this hash value is treated as a Trusted Update

row.entry: File matched by this hash value is not treated as a Trusted Update

entry.p: SHA-1 hash value of this file
Add the file matched by this hash value to the Approved List when it is accessed for the first time
Do not add the file matched by this hash value to the Approved List
Add a note for the file matched by this hash value
Allow actions such as edit, rename, and delete
Block actions such as edit, rename, and delete
Enable protection of the Approved List (in addition to the Write Protection List) when Write Protection is enabled
Disable protection of the Approved List (in addition to the Write Protection List) when Write Protection is enabled
List: Container for the Write Protection List
Use the files in the specified folder and its subfolders
Use the files in the specified folder
<reg_key> can be abbreviated or expanded as shown below:
<reg_key> can be abbreviated or expanded as shown below:
ExceptionList: Container for the Write Protection Exception List
Use the files in the specified folder and its subfolders
Use the files in the specified folder
<reg_key> can be abbreviated or expanded as shown below:
<reg_key> can be abbreviated or expanded as shown below:
Ignore blocked files or processes when Application Lockdown blocks any of the following events:

Quarantine blocked files or processes when Application Lockdown blocks any of the following events:
Process launch
DLL loading
Script file access
Ask what to do for blocked files or processes when Application Lockdown blocks any of the following events:
Allow action by detected network viruses
Block action by detected network viruses
Blocks access of storage devices (CD/DVD drives, floppy disks, and USB devices) to managed endpoints
Allows access of storage devices (CD/DVD drives, floppy disks, and USB devices) to managed endpoints
Allow actions such as edit, rename, and delete
Block actions such as edit, rename, and delete
Allow some drivers (e.g., Touch screen/ Infrared sensor/Android mobile phone) from being loaded when those hardware devices are plugged in and storage device blocking is enabled.
Block some drivers (e.g., Touch screen/ Infrared sensor/Android mobile phone) from being loaded when those hardware devices are plugged in and storage device blocking is enabled.
DeviceException: Container for the Storage Device Blocking device exception list
DeviceGroup: Container for the Storage Device Blocking device list
name : Unique name of the device list
ExceptionList: Container for the Fileless Attack Prevention Exception List
Specify powershell.exe, wscript.exe, CScript.exe, or mshta.exe
Specify yes if argument includes a regular exception
Specify no if argument does not include a regular exception
Parent process of the monitored process
Grandparent process of the monitored process
Great grandparent process of the monitored process
Great great grandparent process of the monitored process
